Notes.Text:
This update for snpguest fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2024-12224: idna: acceptance of Punycode labels that do not produce any non-ASCII output may lead to incorrect
  hostname comparisons and incorrect URL parsing (bsc#1243869).
- CVE-2025-3416: openssl: use-after-free in `Md::fetch` and `Cipher::fetch` when `Some(...)` value is passed to the
  `properties` argument (bsc#1242601).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Server Applications 15 SP6

Vulnerabilities.Description: Improper Validation of Unsafe Equivalence in punycode by the idna crate from Servo rust-url allows an attacker to create a punycode hostname that one part of a system might treat as distinct while another part of that system would treat as equivalent to another hostname.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Server Applications 15 SP6:snpguest-0.3.2-150600.3.6.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: A flaw was found in OpenSSL's handling of the properties argument in certain functions. This vulnerability can allow use-after-free exploitation, which may result in undefined behavior or incorrect property parsing, leading to OpenSSL treating the input as an empty string.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Server Applications 15 SP6:snpguest-0.3.2-150600.3.6.1
